description: Borrowed from Maori and Hawaiian wahine (“woman”), from Proto-Polynesian *fafine.

examples: One Way Wahine was the next beach movie, after Ride the Wild Surf, to be filmed on the sands of Hawaii. It was marketed to the teenage audience as a beach movie but it is a more serious look at the seamy side of Hawaii and the surf bums and one way wahines who go there to make a quick buck.
